author: metachris_
content: We seem to gravitate towards option 1 proposed by <@!543900561460822016> in https://github.com/flashbots/mev-boost/issues/71 - removing `fcU`/`preaparePayload` and having hash+feeRecipient as part of the `builder_getPayloadHeader` call. The builders would prepare blocks for all forks and serve them immediately, without a separate preparation API call.

author: tersec
content: Seems reasonable, at least. As one of these GitHub issues included a comment along these lines about, fcU-unification between what I think of as the non-validating-BN-loop (`newPayload`/`fcU`/repeat) and the validating flow (`fcU`/`getPayload`/`newPayload`) doesn't apply here.

author: tersec
content: As such, the presence of `fcU` in the MEV equivalent of the validating flow is less warranted

author: tersec
content: I guess this is what https://github.com/flashbots/mev-boost/commits/no-init-call does

author: tersec
content: And conceptually, it's probably good that it avoids some intermixing of `engine_` and `builder_` calls beyond what's necessary.

author: metachris_
content: Yes, that branch is for this PR: https://github.com/flashbots/mev-boost/pull/79 - which is implementing a proposal for removing any init call (fcU) and starting the process with `_getPayloadHeaderV1`
